sources.title: Broken Strings (1940) DRAMA
sources.description:
BLACK HISTORY MONTH
Stars: Clarence Muse, Sybil Lewis, William Washington
 Writer/Director: Bernard B. Ray

 After noted violinist Arthur Williams suffers a hand injury which ends his playing career, his hopes are transferred to his son, who prefers swing music to classical.

sources.title: Broken Stings
sources.description: Taken from IMDB: Arthur Williams is a well-known violinist but he has an accident that injures his left-hand fingers and he can no longer play. Being a devotee of the classics, swing music grates his ears. His son, William, also has the soul of a true artist, and while he does well on classical music, his heart is into swing. Needing money, William, enters a contest in which he plans on playing classical music, but his violin has been tampered with by another contestant and when two of his violin strings break, he is forced to play swing.

metadata.Plot: Arthur Williams is a well-known violinist but he has an accident that injures his left-hand fingers and he can no longer play. Being a devotee of the classics, swing music grates his ears. His son, William, also has the soul of a true artist, and while he does well on classical music, his heart is into swing. Needing money, William, enters a contest in which he plans on playing classical music, but his violin has been tampered with by another contestant and when two of his violin strings break, he is forced to play swing.
metadata.Writer: Carl Krusada, Clarence Muse, David Arlen
metadata.Actors: Clarence Muse, Sybil Lewis, William Washington
